instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
Hi, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA that came in as not turning on. (no liquid damage but just didn't turn on one morning)

Found a shorting cap <CAPACITOR>C7431</CAPACITOR> (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>)
Thought it was going to be very easy as it was replaced and diode tested okay. Turns on now and boots, sees the battery serial etc but doesn't charge it. Also sees the battery at 86% on the original and 20% on the known good.

If you pull the magsafe, it cuts power with a battery connected.
Tried another battery, tried another DCIN.

On magsafe only, I get an initial green light that changes to orange, I get 16.5v on Pin 2 & 3 of <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.52v

On battery only, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.4v

Removed F7140 to diode test pin 1 and 2.
Pin 1 = 0.125v
Pin2 = 0.450v

Do I have a short somewhere on PPVBATT side of F7140 or have I gone the wrong direction for fault finding?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, 7151, 7152, 7120, 7121, 7122 all test fine

CSON,CSOP 17-18 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> = 3.1ohms
CSIN,CSIP 27-28 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> = 19.9ohms
SDA,SCL 10-11 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> = 3.99k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
Have you tried a new battery? Usually when the PPBUS caps short they kill the battery....

Also check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>/6

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
Be sure <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is OK.
Also check if <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> is not brohen; post its voltages, on battery only.

"Removed F7140 to diode test pin 1 and 2.
Pin 1 = 0.125v
Pin2 = 0.450v"
Good readings...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply JohnB8812 - Yeah I forgot to mention I checked 7005/6 they both check out fine 9.9ohms, 4.8ohms

Thanks 2informaticos
<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is good at 10.01k 

<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, battery only, not in chassis (F7140 still removed) = 
pin 5 = 3.197v
pin 1,2,3 = 3.178v < took a while to climb to this voltage
pin 4 = 2.302v < took a while to climb to this voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
"pin 5 = 3.197v"
Empty battery, or bad contacts on J6950.
Post again voltages with known good battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Works on charger but not battery
threads.message:
Well, someone switched my good battery and I wrongly assumed the voltage was being pulled down :o

Turns out it needed a new battery :p

Sorry for wasting your time folks.. thank you for the help
